title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel following the journey of a shepherd named Santiago.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A sweeping narrative of human history, from ancient times to the modern era.

title: The C Programming Language
author: Brian W. Kernighan, Dennis M. Ritchie
description: Often referred to as K&R, this book is the definitive work on C programming, covering the language and its features in detail.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A portrait of the Jazz Age and the American dream.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A vision of a technologically advanced future that critiques contemporary society.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality in the Deep South.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about teenage alienation and loss of innocence in the adult world.

title: I Love You to the Moon and Back
author: Amelia Hepworth
description: A heartwarming tale of a parent and child expressing their love for each other.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel about a hobbit's adventure with a group of dwarves.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A story about a man who remains young while his portrait ages.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A story of friendship and redemption set against the backdrop of a changing Afghanistan.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily BrontÃ«
description: A tale of passion and revenge set on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel about a future where books are banned and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
author: C.S. Lewis
description: A story about four children who discover a magical land and fight against an evil witch.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: A love story between two teens who have cancer and their struggles with their illness.

title: The Night Circus
author: Erin Morgenstern
description: A magical competition between two young illusionists set in a mysterious circus.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A coming-of-age story about a young girl growing up in the marshes of North Carolina.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society that treats women as property.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
description: A retelling of the story of Circe, a powerful witch in Greek mythology.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a woman's quest for knowledge and self-discovery.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman's act of violence against her husband.
